column1: 7.3.3.1.3  Summary of evidence and recommendations for sexual-preserving techniques in men
The majority of eligible patients motivated to preserve their sexual function will benefit from sexual-  preserving techniques.
None of the sexual-preserving techniques (prostate/capsule/seminal/nerve-sparing) have shown to be   superior, and no particular technique can be recommended.
Only offer sexual-preserving techniques to eligible men very motivated to preserve their   sexual function.
Select patients based on:  •   organ-confined disease;  •   absence of any kind of tumour at the level of the prostate, prostatic urethra or bladder   neck.
